intro: Adiantopsis paupercula, commonly known as the poor fern, is a rare and delicate fern species native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Adiantaceae, which includes several species of ferns characterized by their delicate fronds and intricate leaf structures. The plant is known for its small, lace-like fronds that are typically less than 10 centimeters in length. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found growing in rocky or shaded areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Adiantopsis paupercula is considered a rare and endangered species.
